briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: With this constructor, Create() should be called in order to create the tool bar.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=0)
memberdef.name: wxRibbonToolBar

briefdescription.para: Construct a ribbon tool bar with the given parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Parent window for the tool bar (typically a wxRibbonPanel).
An identifier for the toolbar. wxID_ANY is taken to mean a default.
Initial position of the tool bar.
Initial size of the tool bar.
Tool bar style, currently unused.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=0)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Create a tool bar in two-step tool bar construction.

detaileddescription.para: Should only be called when the default constructor is used, and arguments have the same meaning as in the full constructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL)
memberdef.name: AddTool

briefdescription.para: Add a tool to the tool bar (simple version).
Add a dropdown tool to the tool bar (simple version).
Add a hybrid tool to the tool bar (simple version).
Add a toggle tool to the tool bar (simple version).

memberdef.argsstring: (int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxBitmap &bitmap_disabled=wxNullBitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL, wxObject *client_data=NULL)
memberdef.name: AddTool

briefdescription.para: Add a tool to the tool bar.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the new tool (used for event callbacks).
Bitmap to use as the foreground for the new tool. Does not have to be the same size as other tool bitmaps, but should be similar as otherwise it will look visually odd.
Bitmap to use when the tool is disabled. If left as wxNullBitmap, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap.
The UI help string to associate with the new tool.
The kind of tool to add.
Client data to associate with the new tool.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer which can be used only with other tool bar methods.

briefdescription.para: Add a separator to the tool bar.

detaileddescription.para: Separators are used to separate tools into groups. As such, a separator is not explicitly drawn, but is visually seen as the gap between tool groups.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL)
memberdef.name: InsertTool

briefdescription.para: Insert a tool to the tool bar (simple version) as the specified position.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)
memberdef.name: InsertDropdownTool

briefdescription.para: Insert a dropdown tool to the tool bar (simple version) as the specified position.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)

briefdescription.para: Insert a hybrid tool to the tool bar (simple version) as the specified position.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)
memberdef.name: InsertToggleTool

briefdescription.para: Insert a toggle tool to the tool bar (simple version) as the specified position.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int tool_id, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxBitmap &bitmap_disabled=wxNullBitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL, wxObject *client_data=NULL)
memberdef.name: InsertTool

briefdescription.para: Insert a tool to the tool bar at the specified position.

parameterdescription.para: Position of the new tool (number of tools and separators from the beginning of the toolbar).
ID of the new tool (used for event callbacks).
Bitmap to use as the foreground for the new tool. Does not have to be the same size as other tool bitmaps, but should be similar as otherwise it will look visually odd.
Bitmap to use when the tool is disabled. If left as wxNullBitmap, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap.
The UI help string to associate with the new tool.
The kind of tool to add.
Client data to associate with the new tool.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer which can be used only with other tool bar methods.

briefdescription.para: Insert a separator to the tool bar at the specified position.
Deletes all the tools in the toolbar.
Removes the specified tool from the toolbar and deletes it.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool to delete.

simplesect.para: true if the tool was deleted, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This function behaves like DeleteTool() but it deletes the tool at the specified position and not the one with the given id.
Returns a pointer to the tool opaque structure by id or NULL if no corresponding tool is found.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos) const virtual size_t GetToolCount() const
memberdef.name: GetToolByPos

briefdescription.para: Return the opaque pointer corresponding to the given tool.

simplesect.para: an opaque pointer, NULL if is a separator or not found.
2.9.4 Returns the number of tools in the toolbar.

briefdescription.para: Return the id assciated to the tool opaque structure.

detaileddescription.para: The structure pointer must not be NULL.

briefdescription.para: Get any client data associated with the tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

simplesect.para: Client data, or NULL if there is none.

briefdescription.para: Called to determine whether a tool is enabled (responds to user input).

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

simplesect.para: true if the tool is enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns the help string for the given tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Return the kind of the given tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Returns the tool position in the toolbar, or wxNOT_FOUND if the tool is not found.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Gets the on/off state of a toggle tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

simplesect.para: true if the tool is toggled on, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Calculate tool layouts and positions.

detaileddescription.para: Must be called after tools are added to the tool bar, as otherwise the newly added tools will not be displayed.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of rows to distribute tool groups over.

detaileddescription.para: Tool groups can be distributed over a variable number of rows. The way in which groups are assigned to rows is not specified, and the order of groups may change, but they will be distributed in such a way as to minimise the overall size of the tool bar.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum number of rows to use.
The maximum number of rows to use (defaults to nMin).

briefdescription.para: Sets the client data associated with the tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Sets the bitmap to be used by the tool with the given ID when the tool is in a disabled state.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Sets the help string shown in tooltip for the given tool.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().
A string for the help.

briefdescription.para: Sets the bitmap to be used by the tool with the given ID.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool in question, as passed to AddTool().

briefdescription.para: Enable or disable a single tool on the bar.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the tool to enable or disable.
true to enable the tool, false to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Set a toggle tool to the checked or unchecked state.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the toggle tool to manipulate.
true to set the tool to the toggled/pressed/checked state, false to set it to the untoggled/unpressed/unchecked state.

briefdescription.para: A ribbon tool bar is similar to a traditional toolbar which has no labels.

detaileddescription.para: It contains one or more tool groups, each of which contains one or more tools. Each tool is represented by a (generally small, i.e. 16x15) bitmap.

The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxRibbonToolBarEvent&event)Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_RIBBONTOOLBAR_CLICKED(id, func): Triggered when the normal (non-dropdown) region of a tool on the tool bar is clicked.
EVT_RIBBONTOOLBAR_DROPDOWN_CLICKED(id, func): Triggered when the dropdown region of a tool on the tool bar is clicked. wxRibbonToolBarEvent::PopupMenu() should be called by the event handler if it wants to display a popup menu (which is what most dropdown tools should be doing).
